dcterms:description: PyDial is an open-source statistical spoken dialogue system toolkit which provides domain-independent implementations of all the dialogue system modules, as well as simulated users and simulated error models. It is used to define different environments for dialogue management.
dcterms:title: PyDial

dcterms:creator: Antoine Bordes
Y-Lan Boureau
Jason Weston
dcterms:description: The BABI dialogue tasks are designed for learning end-to-end goal-oriented dialogue systems, focusing on various dialogue scenarios.
dcterms:title: BABI dialogue tasks

dcterms:creator: Jason Williams
Antoine Raux
Deepak Ramachandran
Alan Black
dcterms:description: The Dialogue State Tracking Challenges (DSTC) provide a series of challenges aimed at improving dialogue state tracking in spoken dialogue systems.
dcterms:title: Dialogue State Tracking Challenges (DSTC)

dcterms:creator: Nikola Mrkši´c
Diarmuid Ó Séaghdha
Blaise Thomson
Milica Gaši´c
Pei-Hao Su
David Vandyke
Tsung-Hsien Wen
Steve Young
dcterms:description: The Cambridge Restaurants dataset is used for multi-domain dialogue state tracking, focusing on restaurant-related queries in Cambridge.
dcterms:title: Cambridge Restaurants

dcterms:creator: Nikola Mrkši´c
Diarmuid Ó Séaghdha

dcterms:description: The San Francisco Restaurants dataset is similar to the Cambridge dataset but focuses on restaurant-related queries in San Francisco.
dcterms:title: San Francisco Restaurants

dcterms:creator: Nikola Mrkši´c
Diarmuid Ó Séaghdha

dcterms:description: The Laptops dataset is used for multi-domain dialogue state tracking, focusing on queries related to laptops.
dcterms:title: Laptops
